column4: i run 'update-grub' and os_probe find a new partition with new ubuntu, grub.cfg is updated, however a reboot always shows the old boot menu?
why isn't the new updated grub.cfg never shown? is there some cache-saved file ?
do you have more then one GNU/Linux installed on your computer?
i have one on sda1, one on sda7, one on sdb2
it only shows menus on sda1 and sda7
whichever you installed Last is most likely the Grub that is in control - be sure you are running "update-grub2" from the correct install
but...it's grub 1.99+ so i run update-grub instead of update-grub2
actually 1.99 is infact Grub2
are you saying i should run update-grub2 after i made those changes?
you need to run update-grub after ANY changes to /etc/default/grub
yes i did that
i also compared the new grub.cfg, the os_prober does find my sdb2 ubuntu
so - are you running this from your most currently installed gnu/linux?
yes
then i can't explain what's happening.  Best of luck!
thanks
r u still here
i 'fixed' the grub problem,
how did you fix it?
natty used its 1.99 grub which caused all thesee trouble, i force installed the lucid grub and now it works
nice.  Glad you figured it out.
